fields.description: a. How do people become infected?
fields.title: a. How do people become infected?
fields.content:
In countries where there is an outbreak, the majority of cases in humans have
occurred as a result of human-to-human transmission. Infection occurs from
direct contact of body fluids (blood, mucus, stool, urine, saliva, sweat,
semen) of a person who is infected. Infection can also occur if broken skin of
a healthy person come into contact with environments that have become
contaminated with an Ebola patient's infectious fluids such as soiled
clothing, bed linen, or used needles.
